error.ProviderNotRegistered: The editor provider is not registered.
error.EmptyRequest: The request should contain at least 1 form param (active/permissions).
error.PermissionNotValid: The specified permission is not valid. Maybe the user or group doesn't exist.
error.CannotLoadIdentities: Can't load identities by specified criteria
error.CannotSavePreferredEditor: Can't save selected editor as preferred one.
error.UnableGetData: An error occurred while reading the data.
error.UnablePostData: An error occurred while saving the data.

admin.title: Web Conferencing Administration
admin.info: Web Conferencing can be handled by different providers. You can enable the provider you need and configure settings.

WebRTC.name: WebRTC
WebRTC.description: Default provider based on WebRTC standard. Let users to place peer to peer call. No browser plugin needed.

modal.title: WebRTC settings
modal.warn: STUN/TURN servers are required to ensure that web conferencing calls will work properly across network routers. We highly recommend setting up your own private TURN server to keep control on the security of your communications and ensure maximum availability.

tooltips.infoStun: STUN/TURN servers are required to ensure that web conferencing calls will work properly across network routers. We highly recommend setting up your own private TURN server to keep control on the security of your communications and ensure maximum availability.
tooltips.infoCsLog: This flag will log information from client in the server logs in order to troubleshoot WebRTC connectivity issue. Use carefully, this mode is verbose and may cause significant network overhead.

removeModal.title: Remove ICE Server?
removeModal.confirmAction: Are you sure you want to remove this server configuration?

Skype.name: Skype
Skype.description: Provider for Skype. Let users to place group and 1:1 calls. No plugin required but Skype app must be installed on client.
